results.title: Productivity primer
results.creator_credit: Biographic Cartoon Films and Bob Godfrey
results.brief_description: A consideration of two issues - what is productivity and why does it matter. To employ more married women, postpone retirement, bring in immigrant workers are some suggested ways of increasing Britain’s output.

results.title: Productivity is people
results.creator_credit: Suzanne Baker, Film Australia and Michael Robertson
results.brief_description: A case-study in management - employee relations based on the concept of a productivity improvement team. In the course of the film the team members express their personal views on advantages of the concept.

results.title: Production unlimited
results.creator_credit: R.V. Edwards, Robert Parker and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australia today”.
Surveys the rapid development of Australian secondary industries, more than doubling output since 1939, with particular reference to the light engineering field.

results.title: Production systems. Part 2
results.creator_credit: Martin Green, Victorian College of Agriculture and Horticulture and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 12 of Series “Growing awareness: Factors in plant production”.
Examines several different case studies on plant production systems. The environment can be manipulated to produce seedlings for retail nurseries, while vegetable seedlings are produced in large quantities needed by growers. Demonstrates hydroponics in a controlled environment being used to grow tomatoes and micro-propogating techniques. Explains how salt-tolerant plants can be cloned, using tissue culture methods to rapidly produce large numbers of plants suitable for use in high salinity areas.

results.title: Production systems. - 1.
results.creator_credit: Martin Green, Victorian College of Agriculture and Horticulture and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 11 of Series “Growing awareness: Factors in plant production”.
The principles applied to commercial plant production are studied by the examination of three case studies. The first is pasture management, where with expert help, resources must be carefully managed to ensure the quality of diary produce. The second case study highlights broad-acre crops, a six year cycle of crop rotation and crop diversity to ensure better economic returns. Lastly, the focus turns to modern orchards and their design in order to ensure increased yields and good crop management.

results.title: Production of foods
results.brief_description: in studying the technology and geography of food production, the following points are given attention: the relation of animal food production to plant food production; methods used to produce plant foods and animal foods; and the important function of the soil in all food production.

results.title: Production of commercial gramophonic discs
results.creator_credit: P.J. Brook and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A look at the various processes involved in the making of a record - from the artists recording onto multi-track tapes, through to the marketing and distribution to the public. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Production control. Part II
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Industrial Management”.
The three final steps in production control scheduling, despatching, and follow up demonstrates the use of the master schedule and of the shop schedule, and how despatching in both centralised and de-centralised forms.
